datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to commercial space travel, space hotels, and cosmic vacations.

columns.name: space_membership
columns.description: Whether the tourist holds any membership with a space exploration organization

columns.name: age_bracket
columns.description: The age range of the tourist.

columns.name: booking_source
columns.description: Source of the booking, either direct or agency

columns.name: pre_trip_training
columns.description: Indicates whether tourists attended a space simulation training before their trip

columns.name: international_travel_experience
columns.description: If the tourist has prior international travel experience, true or false

columns.name: interest_in_space_missions
columns.description: Score based on the interest level in historical and future space missions, measured through a survey

columns.name: number_of_companions
columns.description: Total number of travel companions accompanying the tourist

columns.name: age
columns.description: Age of the tourist

columns.name: participated_in_promotional_events
columns.description: Indicates whether the tourist participated in any promotional events related to space tourism

columns.name: tourist_wealth
columns.description: Estimated total wealth of the tourist.

columns.name: home_country_aerospace_investment_percentage
columns.description: Percentage of GDP invested in aerospace and related high-tech industries in the tourist's home country

columns.name: nutritional_awareness_program
columns.description: Indicates if a nutritional awareness program is available on the spacecraft

columns.name: ratio_space_trips_to_earth_vacations
columns.description: The ratio of space trips to earth vacations taken by a tourist

columns.name: is_weekend
columns.description: Boolean flag indicating whether the departure is scheduled on a weekend.

columns.name: average_tourist_age
columns.description: Average age of the tourists in years.

columns.name: primary_travel_purpose
columns.description: Main reason for the tourist's space travel: leisure, research, or education

columns.name: trip_duration
columns.description: Duration of the trip in days

columns.name: tourist_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for each space tourist

columns.name: proportion_income_spent_on_tech
columns.description: The percentage of a tourist's income spent on technological gadgets and subscriptions.

columns.name: completed_space_travel_training
columns.description: Indicates whether the tourist has completed any formal training courses for space travel

columns.name: age_group
columns.description: Age group of the tourist categorized as youth, adult, or senior

columns.name: daylight_hours_at_launch
columns.description: Average number of daylight hours at the launch site on the day of departure.

columns.name: average_age_of_group
columns.description: Average age of passengers in the travel group

columns.name: length_of_stay_days
columns.description: The number of days the tourist has booked for their stay in a space hotel

columns.name: has_children
columns.description: Indicates whether the tourist has children, true or false

columns.name: travel_class
columns.description: Class of the space travel either suborbital or orbital

columns.name: personal_items_count
columns.description: Number of personal items tourists are allowed to take with them

columns.name: interest_in_celestial_events
columns.description: Whether the tourist booked the trip because of interest in celestial events, such as meteor showers or solar eclipses.

columns.name: luxury_level
columns.description: Represents the luxury level of the trip, higher numbers indicate more luxurious.

columns.name: solar_activity_index
columns.description: Index representing solar activity, including sunspots and solar flares, which could impact energy availability for launches.

columns.name: home_country_GDP
columns.description: Gross Domestic Product of the tourist's home country, expressed in trillions of US dollars

columns.name: previous_space_travel
columns.description: Indicates if the tourist has traveled to space before.

columns.name: crew_size
columns.description: Total number of crew and passengers scheduled for a journey, influencing the preparation time for departure.

columns.name: booking_language_english
columns.description: Indicates whether English was the primary language used during booking

columns.name: age_category
columns.description: Age group of the tourist, categorized into young, middle-aged, or senior

columns.name: marital_status
columns.description: Marital status of the tourist, categorized as single, married, or divorced

columns.name: has_travel_insurance
columns.description: Indicates whether the tourist has purchased travel insurance for space travel

columns.name: government_space_budget_percent_gdp
columns.description: Percentage of the country's GDP allocated to space research and development

columns.name: percent_population_with_space_education
columns.description: Percentage of the population that has received formal education relating to space or astronomy

columns.name: satisfaction_rating
columns.description: Satisfaction rating on a scale from 1 to 10

queries.question: Can you identify any patterns or correlations among tourists' pre-trip training attendance, personal items count, and trip duration in the dataset related to space tourism?
queries.true_hypothesis: Tourists who attend pre-trip space simulation training and bring more personal items tend to opt for longer-duration space trips, likely implying that better psychological preparedness and personal comfort correlate with opting for the maximum between the personal items count squared plus 5 and the personal items count as the trip duration.
